hero.title: MORGANE SUPPA
hero.description: From my earliest steps, I have always been drawn to art and video games. Level Design and Narrative Design were immediately the areas where I felt most comfortable, followed by environmental storytelling and Level Art. My artistic profile merges with my technical skills. My artistic abilities are the foundation of my collaborations with other teams, a combination I consider essential to bring projects to life. I am fortunate to love my job, and it is a pleasure for me to share with you what I have accomplished.

about.title: About me
bento1: With initial experiences in the gaming industry, I started my career in an Escape Room (Secret Door) where I worked on 4 competitive escape rooms (a first in France) and was also a Game Master. I continued my career at the independent Toulouse-based studio Dreamirl as well as the Bordeaux-based studio HammerHead.
In parallel with my career in video games, I am the author and illustrator of a visual novel entitled A Crow's Nest, an adventure in a Dark Fantasy world.
I also draw for role-playing game campaigns and create my own campaigns within universes where I have created the entire world-building.
Each step has shaped my passion and honed my skills.

bento2.title: A few points about me:
content: Graduated in Game Design and Gamification (2020-2023)
Fable The Lost Chapter, Titanfall 2, Ori and The Will Of The Wisps, Apex Legends, Baldur's Gate 3 are my favorite games.
Self-taught in drawing for over 15 years, I do both realism and very dark semi-realism.
Pianist for over 10 years, I also play guitar, ukulele, and sing.
Creator of many Role Play universes on Discord and also a Game Master.

collaborate.title: Let's collaborate
collaborate.description: If my projects interest you, feel free to reach out. I would be delighted to discuss potential collaborations. Looking forward to working with you!

hero.description: Noreya: The Gold Project is a frantic metroidvania game by the Toulouse-based studio Dreamirl, where players must enter a divine conflict where the choice between gold and light will determine their fate.
hero.works: For this project, I worked on Game & Level Design, Narrative Design, and Level Art.

card1.description: The game offers a rich exploration experience, with vast areas to discover and many secrets to uncover. Throughout their adventure, players will have to face a multitude of varied enemies. Players must skillfully navigate through complex environments while overcoming obstacles to progress in the game.

card2.description: Players must solve puzzles to advance. For this one, they need to learn to use the ghost (a phantom double) to succeed. The player must solve the puzzle to pass to the other side. By using a prayer stele, they can switch places with their bodily double. The key to this puzzle is to alternate between the two forms to progress.

card3.description: Boss fights are divided into multiple phases, each bringing its unique challenges. The final boss of the game marks a return to bullet hell style. Each boss has specific attack patterns, requiring players to constantly adapt their strategies. Noreya's bosses are particularly renowned for their complexity and creativity, with unpredictable attacks, testing both the player's mastery and responsiveness.

card4.title: The Gold Project.
card4.description: The game alternates between exploration, puzzle/challenge phases, and boss fights, offering a varied and engaging experience. Players navigate through six distinct biomes, each with a unique artistic direction carefully crafted in coherence with the level design. These diverse environments are not only visually captivating but also designed to enrich the gameplay. This combination of varied gameplay, supported by an immersive aesthetic, creates a satisfying and memorable gaming experience.

card1.description: Players must find the entrance to the speakeasy hidden in the tailor shop's room. After solving a series of puzzles, they will discover the mannequin's arm. By placing this arm in the right place, they can trigger the mechanism that reveals a hidden staircase, allowing them to access the secret speakeasy.

card2.description: Players must find a way to access the distillery, a sub-area of the speakeasy. Players outside the headset give instructions to the burglars. They will discover clues on a champagne bottle indicating the order of the notes for the piano. Players must continue exploring to find the entrance to the boss's office, where the loot is hidden.

card3.description: Players are close to their final objective. The player wearing the VR headset must now give precise instructions to the players outside so they can solve an off-VR puzzle. This puzzle will provide the necessary code to open the safe. This phase of the game heavily emphasizes cooperation, requiring effective communication between players to successfully unlock the safe and reach their loot.

card4.title: The perfect break-in.
card4.description: The game's gameplay consists of searching through different rooms to discover puzzles and clues. These puzzles, once solved, allow players to progress to the next room and reach the loot. Players not wearing the headset have their own set of clues to analyze in correlation with those found in the game. By pooling their clues together, they can deduce the steps needed to solve the puzzles.

card1.description: The disincarnation mechanic is essential for progressing. Here, the player encounters a frightened creature, hiding in a bush. To progress, the player must wait for the creature to come out of hiding and then jump on it. This action unlocks a previously inaccessible passage in the other world. This mechanic encourages reflection and observation of the environment.

card2.description: The game is punctuated by the discovery of narrative locations. These moments allow Cethlenn to tell the story of the places and deepen the context of their common quest. Players learn more about the world's history. These narrative moments add a layer of depth to the exploration, offering a welcome break while enriching the gameplay experience.

card3.description: At the end of each level, players must use their mastery of skills acquired in final confrontations. Here, in a snake-infested temple, the player must avoid their field of vision to avoid returning to the last checkpoint. Disembodiment is necessary to progress, but the patrolling snakes are a major challenge. Players must be quick to get out of the snakes' sight and move on.

card4.title: Echoes of the past.
card4.description: Each level is divided into three parts: The game offers progression through three phases across two different worlds (divine/fomorian): Tutorial, where the player familiarizes themselves with the mechanics; Practice, which allows the player to perfect newly acquired skills; and Mastery, where the player is tested on everything they have learned throughout the level. The main mechanic is to find a way to disincarnate to switch worlds and discover passages to progress. The story adds a narrative layer, reinforcing player engagement through the theme of redemption.

card1.description: The die roll is an essential mechanism for introducing a degree of chance and uncertainty into the resolution of actions. When a character attempts to perform an action, such as succeeding at an attack or solving a puzzle, a die roll is made to determine whether the action succeeds or fails. This system balances the game by creating situations where even the most skilled characters can fail or succeed unexpectedly, adding suspense and dynamics to the unfolding story.

card2.description: Exploration and problem-solving are essential to progress. Here, characters find themselves trapped in a strange hangar. By exploring, players can uncover information about the place and discover the objective to be achieved. They might find notes left by previous occupants, hidden mechanisms or objects useful for unlocking doors or disabling traps.

card3.description: The camera allows players to switch from a top-down view, reminiscent of classic board games, to an immersive view. This transition between perspectives gives players control over their visual experience. Inspired by the BG3 camera, this feature allows players to appreciate the strategy and details of the game. The top-down view is ideal for planning actions and navigating, while the close-up view allows for appreciating the details.

card4.title: Infernal adventure.
card4.description: Each level is divided into three parts: The game offers progression through three phases across two different worlds (divine/fomorian): Tutorial, where the player familiarizes themselves with the mechanics; Practice, which allows the player to perfect newly acquired skills; and Mastery, where the player is tested on everything they have learned throughout the level.
